item.title: 百度称人工智能聊天机器人 "厄尼机器人 "已积累 2 亿用户
item.description: 中国百度周二表示，其人工智能聊天机器人 "二维机器人 "已获得超过2亿用户，它正努力在日益激烈的竞争中保持中国最受欢迎的类似于ChatGPT的聊天机器人的地位。【原文：China's Baidu said on Tuesday its artificial intelligence chatbot “Ernie Bot” has garnered more than 200 million users as it seeks to remain China’s most popular ChatGPT-like chatbot amid increasingly fierce competition.】

item.title: 在政策支持下，中国第一季度 GDP 增长快于预期
item.description: 周二的数据显示，中国第一季度经济增长速度超过预期，这为试图在房地产行业长期疲软和地方政府债务不断增加的情况下支撑经济增长的官员们提供了一些宽慰。【原文：China's economy grew faster-than-expected in the first quarter, data showed on Tuesday, offering some relief to officials as they try to shore up growth in the face of protracted weakness in the property sector and mounting local government debt.】

item.title: 中国第一季度国内生产总值同比增长 5.3%，远高于预期
item.description: 周二的官方数据显示，中国第一季度经济同比增长5.3%，大大超出分析师的预期，这对决策者来说是一个值得欢迎的迹象，因为他们正努力在长期的房地产危机中支撑需求和信心。【原文：China's economy grew 5.3% in the first quarter year-on-year, official data showed on Tuesday, comfortably beating analysts' expectations, a welcome sign for policymakers as they try to shore up demand and confidence in the face of a protracted property crisis.】

item.title: 亚洲股市因美联储重新考虑降息而下滑；中国 GDP 受关注
item.description: 周二，亚洲股市下跌，美元攀升至五个多月高点，原因是美国3月份零售销售强于预期，进一步强化了美联储今年不太可能急于降息的预期。【原文：Asian stocks fell and the dollar climbed to more than five-month highs on Tuesday as stronger-than-expected U.S. retail sales for March further reinforced expectations that the Federal Reserve is unlikely to be in a rush to cut interest rates this year.】

item.title: 零售销售火爆后美元走强，日元萎靡不振；中国数据值得期待
item.description: 周二，美元兑几种同类货币的汇率刚刚触及 11 月初以来的最高点，引发了对干预的担忧，因为在美国零售销售好于预期之后，日元在 1990 年以来的最低点徘徊。【原文：The dollar stood just off its highest since early November against a handful of peer currencies on Tuesday, raising intervention worries as the yen languished at its lowest level since 1990 following hotter-than-expected U.S. retail sales.】

item.title: 戴利说，美国联邦储备委员会不应在不需要时采取紧急行动
item.description: 旧金山联邦储备银行行长玛丽-戴利（Mary Daly）周一表示，美国经济和劳动力市场强劲，通胀率仍高于美联储2%的目标，因此没有降息的紧迫性。 "戴利在斯坦福大学经济政策研究所（Stanford Institute for Economic Policy Research）表示："最糟糕的事情就是在不需要紧急的时候采取紧急行动。戴利是制定美国货币政策的 19 位美国央行行长之一。【原文：San Francisco Federal Reserve Bank President Mary Daly said on Monday there is no urgency to cut U.S. interest rates, with the economy and labor market strong, and inflation still above the Fed's 2% target. "The worst thing to do is act urgently when urgency is not required," Daly said at the Stanford Institute for Economic Policy Research. Daly is one of 19 U.S. central bankers who set U.S. monet】

item.title: 人工智能芯片需求强劲，台积电第一季度利润预计增长 5
item.description: 台湾中芯国际集成电路制造股份有限公司（Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.，简称 "台积电"）是人工智能应用领域先进芯片的主要生产商，由于需求强劲，预计本周四公布的第一季度利润将增长 5%。【原文：Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co , , the dominant producer of advanced chips used in artificial intelligence applications, is expected to report a 5% rise in first-quarter profit on Thursday thanks to strong demand.】

item.title: 华纳兄弟探索公司关闭新闻编辑室后，新西兰 Stuff 集团将制作新闻节目
item.description: 新西兰媒体网站 Stuff Group 周二表示，它已与华纳兄弟探索公司（Warner Bros Discovery）签署协议，为华纳兄弟探索公司的新西兰电视频道提供每天下午 6 点的新闻节目。【原文：New Zealand media site Stuff Group said on Tuesday it had signed an agreement with Warner Bros Discovery to provide Warner Bros Discovery's New Zealand television channel with a 6 p.m. daily news programme.】

item.title: 日本财务大臣称正密切关注外汇走势
item.description: 日本财务大臣铃木俊一周二表示，他正在密切关注货币走势，并将在美元飙升至 34 年新高后做出 "必要的全面回应"。【原文：Japanese Finance Minister Shunichi Suzuki said on Tuesday he was closely watching currency moves and will provide a "thorough response as needed" after the dollar surged to a fresh 34-year high.】

item.title: 以色列权衡应对伊朗袭击的措施，油价上涨
item.description: 以色列军方负责人表示，以色列将对伊朗周末发动的导弹和无人机袭击做出回应，而盟国则呼吁伊朗保持克制，在中东紧张局势加剧的背景下，周二油价上涨。【原文：Oil prices rose on Tuesday amid heightened tensions in the Middle East after Israel's military chief said his country would respond to Iran's weekend missile and drone attack amid calls for restraint by allies.】

item.title: Regeneron 将为美国司法部关于药物定价操纵的指控进行辩护
item.description: 再生元制药公司（Regeneron Pharmaceuticals）周一表示，美国司法部对该公司虚报黄斑变性药物 Eylea 平均销售价格的指控 "毫无根据"，该公司计划在法庭上为此案辩护。【原文：Regeneron Pharmaceuticals said on Monday the U.S. Justice Department's complaint against the company misreporting the average sales price for its macular degeneration drug Eylea is "meritless" and it plans to defend this case in court.】

item.title: 摩根大通首席执行官戴蒙出售约 3,300 万美元股票，完成出售计划
item.description: 周一的一份监管文件显示，摩根大通首席执行官杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）已出售了约 3300 万美元的银行股份，完成了此前披露的出售 100 万股的计划。【原文：JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon has sold about $33 million of his shares in the bank, a regulatory filing showed on Monday, completing a previously disclosed plan to sell 1 million shares.】

item.title: 波音公司声称在举报人作证前未发现老式 787 喷气式飞机存在疲劳问题
item.description: 波音公司周一表示，在经过大量维护的在役 787 喷气式飞机上没有发现疲劳裂纹，该飞机制造商在周三美国参议院听证会前为双通道飞机项目进行了辩护。【原文：Boeing said on Monday it has not found fatigue cracks on in-service 787 jets that have gone through heavy maintenance, as the planemaker defended the twin-aisle aircraft program ahead of a U.S. Senate hearing on Wednesday.】

item.title: 早间竞价投资者情绪低迷，关注中国 GDP
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，美国司法部将对 Live Nation 提起反垄断诉讼
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周一报道，美国司法部准备最快在下个月对 Live Nation 提起反垄断诉讼。【原文：The U.S. Department of Justice is preparing to file an antitrust lawsuit against Live Nation as soon as next month, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday.】

item.title: 对冲基金流动趋势 高盛称对冲基金可能抛售多达 420 亿美元美股
item.description: 高盛（Goldman Sachs）的一份报告显示，如果股市继续回落，追随趋势的对冲基金可能会在下个月抛售 200 亿至 420 亿美元的美国股票。【原文：Trend-following hedge funds could sell between $20 billion and $42 billion in U.S. equities over the next month if the stock market continues to retreat, a Goldman Sachs note shows.】

item.title: 花旗财富部门首席信息官白林将离职
item.description: 花旗集团全球财富部门首席投资官（CIO）戴维-拜林（David Bailin）周一在 LinkedIn 上发帖称，他将于下月离职，此前他已在该行工作了 15 年。【原文：Citigroup's David Bailin, chief investment officer (CIO) at the global wealth division, will leave next month after 15 years at the bank, he said in a LinkedIn post on Monday.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称洛克希德公司赢得价值 170 亿美元的美国导弹防御合同
item.description: 两位知情人士告诉路透社，洛克希德-马丁公司获得了一份价值 170 亿美元的合同，负责开发下一代拦截器，以防止美国遭受洲际弹道导弹袭击。【原文：Lockheed Martin has been awarded a $17 billion contract to develop the next generation of interceptors that would guard the United States against an intercontinental ballistic missile attack, two industry sources briefed on the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 开源组织称更多软件项目可能成为破坏目标
item.description: 两个开放源代码组织在周一发布的一份警报中说，最近一个身份不明的行为者试图破坏一个广泛使用的软件程序，这可能是数次试图颠覆互联网上关键数字基础设施的行为之一。【原文：The recent attempt by an unknown actor to sabotage a widely used software program may have been one of several attempts to subvert key pieces of digital infrastructure across the internet, two open source groups said in an alert published on Monday.】

item.title: 美联储逆回购机制迅速收缩，为近三年来最低
item.description: 周一，美联储从货币市场基金和其他机构吸收现金的一个重要机构的资金流入量急剧下降。【原文：A key Federal Reserve facility that takes in cash from money market funds and others saw inflows drop sharply on Monday.】

item.title: 美国机构将在听证会上调查航空公司忠诚度计划中的不公平行为
item.description: 美国运输部和消费者金融保护局的发言人周一表示，作为保护消费者免受欺骗和不公平行为侵害的努力的一部分，这两个机构将举行一次公开听证会，调查航空公司的忠诚度计划。【原文：As part of an effort to protect consumers from deceptive and unfair practices, the U.S. Department of Transportation and Consumer Financial Protection Bureau will hold a public hearing looking into airline loyalty programs, spokespeople for both agencies said on Monday.】

item.title: 赌场运营商米高梅起诉美国联邦贸易委员会，要求阻止对 2023 年黑客事件的调查
item.description: 美高梅国际酒店集团（MGM Resorts International）正在起诉美国联邦贸易委员会（Federal Trade Commission），以阻止调查去年黑客攻击事件对数据安全造成的影响。【原文：MGM Resorts International is suing the U.S. Federal Trade Commission to block a probe into the impact on data security of the dramatic hack that hobbled the casino operator last year.】

item.title: 纽约联储称，美国工人寻求创纪录的工资以考虑新工作
item.description: 纽约联储周一公布的最新数据显示，3月份美国人表示愿意接受的新工作最低工资创下历史新高。【原文：The lowest wage Americans said they were willing to accept to take a new job reached a record high in March, new data from the New York Federal Reserve showed on Monday.】

item.title: 通用汽车计划将总部迁至底特律的另一座大楼--消息来源
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的人士周一表示，通用汽车公司在位于文艺复兴中心的河畔总部度过了 20 多年后，将把总部迁往底特律市中心更深处。【原文：General Motors is moving its headquarters deeper into downtown Detroit after spending more than 20 years in its riverfront home at the Renaissance Center, a person familiar with the matter said on Monday.】

item.title: Evercore 策略师支持黯淡的标普 500 指数观点，预计盈利前景将更加疲软
item.description: Evercore ISI 的策略师认为，随着企业发布谨慎的前景展望，美国的盈利预期可能会减弱。【原文：U.S. earnings estimates are likely to weaken as companies issue cautious outlooks, according to Evercore ISI strategists, who stood by their view the S&P 500 will end the year well lower than current levels.】

item.title: Tapestry 与范思哲所有者卡普里的合并获得欧盟和日本批准
item.description: Coach 母公司 Tapestry 斥资 85 亿美元收购 Michael Kors 所有者 Capri Holdings 的交易已获得欧盟和日本监管部门的批准。【原文：Coach parent Tapestry's $8.5 billion deal to buy Michael Kors owner Capri Holdings has received regulatory clearance from the European Union and Japan, the companies said on Monday.】

item.title: 特斯拉高级电池主管离职
item.description: 特斯拉动力总成和能源工程高级副总裁德鲁-巴格里诺（Drew Baglino）周一在社交网站 X 上发帖称，他在这家汽车制造商工作 18 年后将离职。【原文：Tesla's senior vice president of powertrain and energy engineering, Drew Baglino, is leaving after 18 years at the auto-maker, he said in a post on social media site X on Monday.】

item.title: 美国 2 月份商业库存回升
item.description: 在零售商和批发商强劲增长的带动下，2 月份美国商业库存有所增加，这表明库存投资可能会促进第一季度的经济增长。【原文：U.S. business inventories rose in February amid strong gains at retailers and wholesalers, suggesting that inventory investment could contribute to economic growth in the first quarter.】

item.title: 汉莎航空以罢工和运力不足为由，下调 2024 年展望
item.description: 汉莎航空（Lufthansa）周一下调了 2024 年的盈利预期，将一系列罢工和产能提升慢于计划的原因归咎于盈利预警，导致其股价下跌超过 4%，创下五个月以来的新低。【原文：Lufthansa slashed its 2024 earnings outlook on Monday, blaming a series of strikes and a slower than planned ramp-up of capacity, in a profit warning that sent its share price sliding by more than 4% to a five-month low.】

item.title: 4 月份美国住宅建筑商信心保持稳定
item.description: 周一公布的数据显示，由于利率的不确定性使潜在购房者犹豫不决，美国房屋建筑商的信心在4月份保持稳定，达到去年7月以来的最高点，结束了连续四个月的上涨。【原文：U.S. homebuilder confidence held steady in April at the highest since last July, snapping four months of gains with uncertainty about interest rates keeping potential home buyers hesitant, data released Monday showed.】
